channel.title: Timing info in the result – Politepix

item.title: Timing info in the result
item.dc:creator: OT
item.description:
Hello,

Do you have plans to include the timing info in the recognition results (e.g. start/end times at the word, or even phoneme level)

item.title: Reply To: Timing info in the result
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description: You can receive more timing information by turning on OpenEarsLogging, but there is no plan to return that info as delegate methods.

item.title: Reply To: Timing info in the result
item.dc:creator: wenhuizhao
item.description:
Pocketsphinx has api to get start/end frame, acoustic score and language score for each word: ps_seg_frames, ps_seg_prob.
This two api return timing information as well as score for each word.
Is there anyway to get this api work in OpenEars?

item.title: Reply To: Timing info in the result
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description: Certainly, you can make any modifications to the Pocketsphinx code you like and recompile the framework. OpenEars doesn’t interfere with that, it just doesn’t return this data along with hypotheses through its own API.

item.title: Reply To: Timing info in the result
item.dc:creator: wenhuizhao
item.description: Thanks for the quick response. Is there any instruction for recompile the framework from source code?

item.title: Reply To: Timing info in the result
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description: You’re actually just opening up OpenEars.xcodeproj after making your changes and pressing “run”.
